Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: bthrustr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Miami a few times and many of the airport hotels are in crowded, noisy areas. The Springhill Suites is close to the airport, yet off the beaten path in an area made up mostly of office parks. A complimentary airport shuttle is available. There is a shopping area about a mile down the road with restaurants, a Publix, etc. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the property was clean and well-maintained. I was there as part of a group and everyone seemed to enjoy their stay. I was chatting with another guest who told me they stay at the Springhill Suites any time they come to Miami because of the service they get there.The only complaint I have is that our carpets were damp (I assume they had just been cleaned) resulting in wet socks. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: ANJU L
Reviews.Content: Great Service! From the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff all were kind and professional at all times. The house keeping staff understood that we had a sick child and worked around our schedule and were never intrusive. Great hotel for families visiting Miami Children's Hospital. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience But Below Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: jackp741
Reviews.Content: Difficult to review our stay here...nothing too negative to report...but as a Marriott Platinum member, it didn't provide the warm feelings that we have grown to love at Marriott. This is an excellent hotel for families, not so good for couples or mature people seeking a restful and relaxed stay.The problems: ELEVATORS... hotel has two elevators which were not upgraded when the property was converted to a Spring Hill Hotel. They are SLOW and this is a seven floor building. If you are on the upper floors....good luck! Families get on the elevators going up to get a spot so when the elevator arrives at the top, it is full. Horrible way to start the morning. BREAKFAST...a ZOO! Since there are so many families, this creates a shortage of tables and jams up the breakfast lines. Not a good experience! ENTRANCE: There is no way to get from the front parking lot to the hotel entrance without walking between parked cars...the parking space in front of the fountain should be "off limits" for parking to provide a walkway to the hotel. At 11:30PM we entered the hotel, forced to walk by the fountain and was showered by the sprinkler. Why have the sprinkler on at that time at the only entrance to the hotel. SO...good for families....not good for us so we won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a 1 night stay in Miami.”
Reviews.Author: fernan_aguero
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 4 on our way to Disney @ Orlando. The complimentary shuttle to and from the airport worked perfectly, and the room was perfect, with ample room for all 4 of us. Very nice and comfortable. Only minus is the lack of places to eat at walking distance, although you can order food to be delivered at your room. Certainly a hotel I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unhelpful front desk staff, poor shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah154960
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to catch a cruise, and again for one night on the way back. The property itself is ok, we had a room with a couch, two dbl beds, a small kitchen, and one bathroom. It was relatively clean, and the breakfast was hot and included. It was recommended to us by our travel agent. Our troubles began the moment we tried to catch the complimentary shuttle to the hotel. We got off our flight around 8:00pm, trucked to the right place with our luggage, and watched as every other hotel chain in history had their shuttles flying by for an hour. We finally called the front desk to inquire about the shuttle and to ask them to let the driver know we were waiting. The person who answered the phone said that the shuttle comes every 30 minutes and that it was an all white 15 pac van. They did not call the driver. Frustrated we hung up and waited for another 30 minutes. When the shuttle arrived and we tried to get on, it was too full. The driver said he would be back in 30 minutes. At this time we had waited almost two hours and grabbed a cab. I was upset when we hit the hotel, and in their favour they did reimburse the cab ride but made no other offers. Checkout the next morning ran smoothly. When we arrived back after our cruise we wanted to go to South Beach and inquired at the front desk on the best way and least expensive way to get there. They suggested city transit and sent us wandering around the streets looking for the bus stop. No map or bus listing was offered. We finally stopped at the hyatt whose shuttle drive graciously offered to take us to the airport where we could catch a direct bus for $5. He then provided a list of buses, maps, and times, as well as his card to call when we were ready to go home and we weren't even staying at the hotel! When we arrived back at Miami Springhill suites we all wanted to show (8 adults sharing two adjoining rooms), and as we tried this the water would stop flowing in one shower for 5 minutes, flow in the other, and then back to the original one. Only one shower could work at a time. Upon calling the front desk they explained their plumber was unavailable and they would send someone up. No attention was given to the matter before we checked out. The next morning we needed the 5am shuttle for a 7am flight, and it was over capacity. Rather than making alternative arrangements, the hotel said he would be back in 30 minutes. Luckily we got on, but some didn't. Overall I found the service poor and unfriendly at this hotel and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was so nice..when ever I needed help the call or I went to the front desk and anyone that was at the frony desk help me”
Reviews.Author: Missa2013
Reviews.Content: The agent that cleaned my room her name is Caridad..she is was so nice

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: BVITortola_12
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms(suites).Good shuttle service. Great breakfast. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, except for the breakfast expedition each morning”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Overall, nice hotel. Good location, nice room (with view on the lake), clean, nice pool. Breakfast was a challenge though. Breakfast area just too small for the amount of people staying there. Some items ran out well before breakfast end time. I do have to say though that breakfast issues are not always entirely to blame on the hotel, as some guests are stacking up huge amounts of food and either don't eat all of it or take it to their rooms. Also, young kids were experimenting with the waffles, so you were just standing there waiting until their games were over. The Springhill Suites chain typically offers a very good price on their nicely decorated and equipped rooms, so they have to save on something.........and that is the breakfast! So, what you could do is to just take the nice deal and pay $20-50 less than a comparable room in another hotel, forgo the free breakfast and grab a nice breakfast at Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean rooms with free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: uvasag
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a night before our cruise. It's a good hotel with clean rooms and the receptionist was nice enough to switch our rooms so I could get the lake view room. Breakfast is good with waffle maker, yogurt, eggs, sausages, fruits, cereal, bagels, bread etc. The only thing I wished was for a bigger bathroom with the sink inside the bathroom instead of outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for suite life!”
Reviews.Author: Cindywe22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times, Parkin my car safely for free vs paying airport fees. Rates are inexpensive. Free wifi and great sevice from beginning of stay till end. There is no restaurant, bar or room service but they have a quick market for small sundries in house. Also, there's a grocery store nearbye and plenty of restaurants. Free Shuttle will even take u too an from. They also offer free airport shuttle. The room itself is more like a mini suite. Open concept where bed blocked by half wall, other side of half wall is a trendy couch. across from that was the kitchen/work office station. The kitchen consisted of a wet bar sink, mini fridge and microwave. The entire room was decently clean and decorated in an up to date and contemporary. Free breakfast is very well maintained and just enough for a morning traveller and definitely a hungry family.

Reviews.Title: “Grateful”
Reviews.Author: Marg C
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West, FL for a family wedding when our grandchild became ill. She was taken to Miami Childrens Hospital in the middle of the night. We searched for a hotel for hours that would be close to the hospital. No luck with everyone booked. The nurse manager and social worker at the hospital called SpringHill Suites and they found a room for us at a great rate. A big thank you to the staff at SpringHill. They went out of their way to help us during this ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: CamberleyResident
Reviews.Content: Our gravely ill newborn grandson was flown to Miami Children's Hospital, an outstanding centre of excellence, on 9 November 2011, just as we flew in from UK to meet the little chap. While he was placed in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, my wife and I joined our daughter and her husband. The hospital recommended checking into Springhill Suites, where we ended up staying for 8 days. We were assigned two suites, one for each couple. The staff were superb -- kind, considerate (they knew the circumstances that brought us), responsive, thoughtful and effective. Each day the front desk staff asked after our grandson. Not knowing Miami, we had plenty of questions every day; these were answered comprehensively and helpfully. We were delighted with the complimentary breakfast. The accommodation was clean, spacious, comfortable and well appointed. As a place to base yourself for a visit to Miami, I emphatically recommend Springhill Suites. They are conveniently close to the airport, not far from downtown, provide what seemed very adequate parking (we had no vehicle but saw a reasonable number of unused spaces at all times) and can summon taxis from a nearby cabrank rapidly. You need to know that there is no restaurant, so you need to cater for lunch and dinner either by eating out or using the microwave oven in each suite. There is also no bar. However a shopping mall is located conveniently within half a mile of the suites and we made use of local takeaway services a couple of times. (The front desk has a list of recommended food providers.) Leila and Armando are but two of the names of staff I noted but frankly it is unfair to single out individuals -- all the staff who dealt with us (Reception, cleaner, breakfast attendants and management) were people Marriott can be very proud of. Oh yes. And our grandson is alive, well and an absolute joy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Airport”
Reviews.Author: RicardoTello
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 2-nights stay at SpringHill, big room, great service, a lady at the front desk was very helpful when asked her how to get an address. If you don't have a car (thought it's extremely recommended in Miami) they can give you the contact of a taxi service that help me a lot. Free wifi Internet and free airport shuttle. For me location was good since I only wanted to do some shopping, specially at Dolphin Mall and Best Buy that are only 20 minutes far (around $20 in taxi from and to hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Big room, great bed, and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Guidoncio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at SpringHill for a night and they receive 7 packages in my name before I Check-in without any cost. I got a Studio, with a lot of space, 2 queen size bed, free Wi-fi internet, and a good breakfast. The only cons is the size of parking lot, was huge crowd. The hotel location is great, but is a little hidden from the NW 7th St, there is no shop nearby. Because of this, there is no street sound, so you can sleep well without any disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a place to lay my head and sleep in peace!”
Reviews.Author: travelingraysgirl1
Reviews.Content: I arrived late into the evening., approx. 4am. I was tired, weery, and upset. I was staying at the Hilton Homewood sutes when I discovered bed bugs and was moved to this hotel at that point. My first impression was not as nicely deocorated as I would have liked, but very modern decor none the less. The man at check in Was Alvaro and he was completely welcoming and helpful. He searched for a crib that maintenance could not find anywhere. He was my hero that night when he showed up at my room shortly after check in with a portable playpen. Great, I may get some sleep. Really appreciated his efforts and it meant a lot to me that he didn't give up and found one. Truly great customer service fournd here. The room itself is more like a mini suite. Open concept where bed blocked by half wall, other side of half wall is a trendy couch. across from that was the kitchen/work office station. The kitchen consisted of a wet bar sink, mini fridge and microwave. The entire room was decently clean and decorated in an up to date contemporary style. I checked out the room and found the cleanliness adequate, did wipe down the kitchen area myself as some marks or stains were found on counter and in microwave. Otherwise good. Also, checked bed and couch for bed bugs and none were found. Very pleased about that as left the Hilton Homewood Suites for just that reason. The hotel offers free wifi internet and a business center. They have an onsite ATM machine as well. They have a small mini market that is open at all hours on the other side of the check in desk. They have nice laundry facilities that I took advantage of and were well priced. Cost me $5 total to do 1 load, including washer, dryer, detergent and softener. The machines are in good working order and everything came out clean and dry. The front desk employees were great. Very helpful and friendly. Didn't mind spending time down stairs in the lobby guest area. Also, in this area they provide complimentary coffee and tea. This hotel also offers free breakfast but I never took advantage of it for the two mornings I stayed. My granddaughter was not well and I too was becoming sick. Stayed in room and tried to rest. Had my own groceries for us to eat in room. I bought when I started out at the First hotel I stayed at (Ramada Airport North) that was close to amenities. I did look out at their pool area and it seemed boring with just a rectangular pool with some seating and a fence. Nothing fancy there. I would stay at this hotel pre cruise for one night and post cruise for one night. It is convenient for that and you can book shuttle to sea port for $12 each. Airport shuttle is free. I don't think I could stay longer here unless I were driving. This visit I was not and felt stranded here as there is no where to walk around, other than risking mine and baby's life and running over the freeway release lanes to the side walk on the other side. There were no side walks on this side of the hotel and I would not dare walk down the road. The drivers would never notice you as they drive fast down the exit lanes and there is a hill that would not allow for you to see the car or the car see you until it would be too late. My final opinion would be:I would stay again for a visit before or after cruise but not longer unless I was driving. The customer service is excellent and the room was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room.....big,elegant and clean and with a very nice bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Ester83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great! We where here for 1 night before cruising. they arranged for us a free transportation form the airport and a transportation to the ship for 20$ pp! The room was very big, with a sofa , a small kitchen (with coffee machine and microwave) and a very very comfortable bed!!!!! the bathroom was big too and it was all perfectly cleaned! The breakfast in morning was very good and with a good variety of food. The only bad thing is the position....it is not really in the central area of the city and itÂ´s lil far away from South Beach....plus there is nothing much to do in the area where it is situated....but if you have a car.....itÂ´s not a big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellente Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: IbizaSpecialist
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 5 nights on nov 6th 2011. I always go to this hotel, they have recently renewed it. Rooms are very confortable for the 4 persons we are. 2 Adults, 2 Kids. Breakfast Amazing!!! Staff really Nice.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine but there are drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed for 3 nights in two rooms booked at the last minute because of travel disruption (we were due to fly back to the UK via JFK but the snowstorm disrupted plans) at a rate of $139 + tax. The hotel was chosen because it was (i) available when booked at ~8:30pm on Saturday night; (ii) it had a free shuttle to and from the airport; (iii) it was a reasonable rate, and (iv) it was a Marriott and normally they are a reliable brand. Also, of course, the Trip Advisor reviews were fine. I'd rate the hotel at 31/2 stars if I could. It's generally fine, staff helpful, the 'suite like' rooms a decent size, comfortable and everything worked. The free wifi was slow but adequate. What detracts: Well, our room needed a good deep clean. Carpets and sofa upholstery especially. Don't get me wrong, it's superficially clean but it's right on the edge of falling over into 'grotty' with stains on the carpet and so on. Secondly, as others have noted it gets *very* busy at breakfast. On Sunday morning I thought it was just Sunday, but the same was true on Monday and Tuesday. Finding seating is pure luck and it's a bit of a bun fight. Other points: The workout room is pathetic and they only offer king sized beds - there are no Queens although the sofa is a sofa bed. It's also not near anywhere. It's on a business park with nothing in sensible walking distance. As far as I could tell the nearest 'plaza' is about 1 mile away. However, it very convenient for the airport and the shuttle works well. I'd stay again for a one night layover only.

Reviews.Title: “First and last stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend to try out something new since we come to Miami so often, but regret to say that we wish we would have stayed somewhere else. The hotel is overcrowded, good luck finding a space to sit to eat breakfast. The security is a concern to us. We read in the room about not ordering from flyers that are put under the door, but during the night we heard voices outside and saw flyers being put under the door, two of them in one night. The next night we saw pizza delivery cars from the same company they said not to order from. Why are they allowing these local places to enter the hotel at night to put flyers under doors? Also, our second night the key didnt work so we went downstairs and told the clerk, ,she immediately put the key in some box and gave it back. No ID required. Very scary. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Long term "resident"”
Reviews.Author: Lee Y
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very accommodating. Rooms nice, breakfast very good. The staff is what made the stay for me. The front desk was always willing to help and was never stumped by my many questions and odd requests. The housekeepers were courteous, friendly and very efficient. Maintenance issues never went more than a few hours before resolution. Location was perfect for my travels and work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: JakeFlake
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property while visiting Miami on business for 5 days. The room was perfect for me. A separate couch with moveable worktables, a kitchen area with sink, microwave and refridge. Flat screen TV able to be seen from both the bed area and couch area. Vanity is outside the bathroom in the room, this worked fine for me since I was staying alone in the room. MIght be an issue if someone was trying to sleep while another was getting ready. Free wifi was great! The hotel is not walking distance to anywhere, you would need the shuttle to take you or rent a car. Hotel provided breakfast area each morning that was complimentary. Eggs & sausage, waffle maker, apples and bananas, yogurt, cereal, muffins, juice and coffee. The eggs/sausage didn't taste very good any of the mornings....I stuck to the waffles which were very good. Sugar free syrup would have been a nice addition. It was very busy at breakfast each morning, with Saturday morning being the worst. Everyone was tripping over each other, not a welcomed thing in the morning. My suggestion would be to go as early as you can. The main reason for my "average" rating was the noise factor in the hotel. I always ask for a quiet room. They put me at the end of a hall on the 2nd floor which I thought would be fine. Turns out there is a room for maintenance across the hall from my room, which during daytime hours was very VERY loud. People putting together TVs, unloading boxes etc. Plus the place doesn't appear to be very well insulated. When someone would open and close their room door, it was very disturbing inside the other rooms. Overall, I had an ok stay with the highlight being the comfortability of the rooms themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Love Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Fanny B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was friendly. We had no problems whatsoever. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: TexasNolefan
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay and I felt it was a very good value. The property seemed new or very well kept. The staff at check in and check out were very nice. They provided a list of nearby restaurants and provided good directions on how to get there, They even provided warnings of some places not to order from. The room was a suite so it had plenty of room. Everything was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. There was a microwave and refrigerator in the room plus a large flat screen TV. My only complaint was an overly loud air conditioning unit, I should have requested a room change. Breakfast was very good and there were two waffle makers. I did not experience any security issues. This property is convenient to the airport. I can strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: LBama529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to a cruise. Delightful stay. Decor is pleasant and up-to-date. Rooms are spacious and clean. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Ask about the cruise and park package if you will be traveling to the port. They allow you to purchase a package that includes leaving your car at the hotel and transportation to the port. The hotel is slightly confusing to locate because of construction in the area currently but I would highly recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great package and nice people”
Reviews.Author: PhDNana
Reviews.Content: Package deal--room, breakfast, transportation to port, free parking during cruise! Nice people, especially Armondo who was super helpful. Nicely appointed suite. Quiet. Good breakfast. Made pre and post cruise easy. Would definitely recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Rojan
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. One before our flight to Ecuador and one on our return from Ecuador. Both rooms were great. A/C worked well and the beds were comfy with good pillows. Most importantly VERY quiet no airport noise. Shuttle is very good and they are most accomodating to take you to restaurants in the area. As others have said they don't run after 11 at night. We took a cab which cost us $15. We felt the free breakfast made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “KUDOS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie B
Reviews.Content: We Love Omar, he was very efficient and timely. Hopefully next year he will be here to assist us with our travel. KUDOS!! KUDOS TO OMAR AND SPRINGHILL SUITES!!!!! THANKS TO ALL THE STAFF!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for price range”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Good, clean, comfortable & modern. Free breakfast, wi-fi and parking. Exercise room is small but good. Two modern treadmills, and elliptical and free weights. Also has a very convenient washer and drier room. Breakfast was a bit crowded but other than that it was great

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it”
Reviews.Author: Leon97
Reviews.Content: A very good value for money. Liked: Very accomodating staff esp the fornt office person from Puerto Rico and the Breakfast lady. Spacious room wtih a separate sitting room with sofa, free continental breakfast Disliked: Bothroom door - ugly and badly designed

Reviews.Title: “A bright spot after a horrible cruise!”
Reviews.Author: AMad04
Reviews.Content: Our pre-cruise hotel was horrible, so I decided to change hotels for our post-cruise stay. I am so glad I did. This hotel is a breath of fresh air. The customer service was great, we were hungry and needed to get to a restaurant that was family friendly, the hotel shuttle provided this service for no extra cost. The rooms are big and kid friendly. We even had a bayside view which was so relaxing. The breakfast was good and fresh. I cannot say enough about this hotel, because after a bad pre-cruise hotel stay and an even worse cruise week, this helped us go home on a great note.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has potential”
Reviews.Author: didi_dabest
Reviews.Content: The property is nice but there are several things the staff could do to make the guest experience better. The shuttle service is horrific! I was told the shuttle runs every hour and so I was at the airport at 10 mins to 10 waiting on the shuttle after 30 mins the shuttle flew past us and as the driver was on his cell he did not see us flagging him down (I don't even think he was looking). I called the hotel and asked them to call the Driver so that he can spin back around - they then told me the shuttle is on request. After 15 mins I called back the hotel and he was back at the hotel. I waited another 15 mins for the shuttle to return. RIDICULOUS! While waiting on the shuttle I was amazed at how often the shuttles for other hotels, some even further away from the airport and some lower budget, would run. On our way out the shuttle was late and we got to the airport and had to rush to catch our flights. Additionally the sign on the shuttle is very low and is on the driver's door making it difficult to spot. We stayed for 5 nights and eat the exact same breakfast every day including the same yogurt flavours (vanilla and blueberry). This was also echoed by the guests staying in the room next to us. Change these two thing and I would stay here again until then there are plenty of hotel choices in Miami

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: flaymingyon
Reviews.Content: Chose this for the free airport shuttle and free parking. Check in was professional and fast with great help on local restaurants that they will even take you to. The room was lovely, though the bathroom was tight and the sink area was open to the rest of the room so getting ready for an early morning flight while others were still sleeping wasn't so pleasant for them with the light. Also a really weird thing was that our bathroom and sink area would fill with cigarette smoke odor. I figured this was due to other rooms being smoking rooms, but no, this was supposed to be a non smoking hotel. Could it be people outside smoking where the ventillation ducts pull air in? Whatever, it was unpleasant and woke me up with such a strong odor. If I'd realized it was a non-smoking building I might have called someone. Lots of crumbs under cushions when making up the sofa bed. Fresh linens were stored in a dresser drawer. No neighbor nor hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WoOdYB1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on June 22 and everything was great. The staff was very professional and friendly; the hotels is very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again when I am in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “I love the hotels rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: mcmac24
Reviews.Content: We stay for a month for my husbands business. the only thing i have to say about the service is the internet we stay in the 7th floor and the internet conection was very weak. Our housekeeper Anastacia was very friendly and helpfull our room and bathroom was very clean every day. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place”
Reviews.Author: DanyOliveira
Reviews.Content: Everything was excelent ,me and my family spend a great time in the hotel.. the breakfastt was really good and the server Anays and Nuris the two ladys are the best , the room as an great view to lake ,,, all service was perfect for our vacation , thank you so much i will get back soon bye muito obrigado

Reviews.Title: “"EXCELLENT STAY"”
Reviews.Author: Ianmarcos
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 2 nights and we really have to say that it exceeded our expectations. I was surprised, couldn't ask for any better. Excellent price , free parking, great free breaskfast, great staff, clean room, pool, gym etc. I want to thank, especially to Manuel for his recommendation to such awesome place and for his super effort in making sure my family and I were comfortable. Junior for his excellent service to the airport. Front staff at time to check in and out Oscar and Armando for their profesionalism and advices for reasonable places to eat. Also, Anastacia for her effort in keeping 7th floor clean. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: cruiselady77
Reviews.Content: stayed one night for pre cruise and couldnt have asked for more. The room was clean and spacious and the fridge actually kept things cold. we needed extra towels and got them right away from housekeeping. Although the lobby was crowded the next morning we had no problem getting breakfast . Our shuttle for the cruise port that we scheduled the day before came right on time and there was no hassle. All the staff was very friendly and we will stay here again when leaving out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: FAMB1967
Reviews.Content: Good price, nice bedrooms, good breakfast, free parking, nice people, free internet. The rooms are clean and confortable. The hotel is in a nice place, near from everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Muy bueno!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marriott57
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff provided excellent service, breakfast was GREAT!!! Waffles, eggs, sausage, asst fruits milk etc. Oscar and Yunio were the BEST!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for our Anniversary (pre cruise trip)”
Reviews.Author: SouthernLady8604
Reviews.Content: We were quite surprised that the hotel was so near everything. The picture on the web page does not do it justice. The staff when we checked in and out, Jessica and Oscar, were just awesome.. Their recommendation for places to eat were right on the money. Anytime we needed something, I did not hesitate to call and ask because they really make you feel that you are a guest and they are there to help you. Our needs were taken care of by just a phone call and I mean that literally. I do hope that hotel managers read this little comment because these two deserved some 'attaboys' and whatever other incentives the staff is offered. Will I stay there again. Ya betcha and will bring family and friends... Good job Oscar and Jessica..

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: hant37851
Reviews.Content: This is a run-down hotel that they "renovated" and claim as "new'. Scuff marks on the walls, lights by the bed don't work, maintenance is low-grade. The clock in our room blinked the wrong time when we got in -- the maid did not even bother setting it. Towels are sheet-thin, lights are jarring flourescent, the odor of the clean smells like stale cigarettes. The bathtub is very dangerously slippery. They had peeled off the anti-slip strips in the bathtub (the marks are visible) and it has no handrails. In our room, the shower rod was broken, probably because a previous guest had slipped and grabbed onto the curtain to break the fall. Instead of fixing it right, they just shove it back into the vinyl wall of the tub enclosure. To make the whole stay completely horrible, after we arrived home, the manager charged our credit card $250 for "room damage" to the shower rod, which we had reported to them was broken when we got there. The staff is surly and unfriendly. The breakfast included was pathetic. Overall, our worst stay in Miami ever.

Reviews.Title: “Standard SpringHill Suites - not enough airport shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price. I stayed for $116 on a Thursday night. I was upgraded to an Executive Double room - spacious (although I had reserved a King bed, I don't complain much about doubles if they are good size). Nice HDTV in room. The hotel lost power for 5 minutes in the evening, and that was scary, but all was restored. The airport pickup service is nice but be careful....make sure you establish which hotel it is, and don't rely on the driver to confirm. Their English isn't that good, and as a result, I was left at the airport because of confusion over which SpringHill Suites by Marriott property this was. It was partially my fault (for not matching up the name with the shuttle) but the driver could have been better trained to answer my question. They are very good about providing shuttle service to/from nearby restaurants. The room temperature is challenging to control, although it wasn't terribly uncomfortable. They have in-room, in-wall units that work --- almost too well. The issue was controlling how cool the room became, without shutting off the unit entirely. In the end, I got a good night's sleep, which is all that matters, especially for the price. Breakfast is standard SpringHills suites stuff - substantial, with a large area to dine, and kept clean. Kudos! My only strong beef is that airport shuttle service from the hotel is only once an hour, on the hour. I believe this should either go two times per hour and/or on demand. They seem to have the capability to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MissingOrion
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. We got adjoining rooms and the front desk staff was great. The breakfast is free and if I traveled with kids, I would choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but has ants.”
Reviews.Author: MMenegatto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good with breakfast and parking included. The bad thing is that you will find lots of small ants inside the room. The hotel must take care of it!

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night in early March. We got in around 9:30 p.m.; check-in was quick and friendly. When we got to the room, the first thing I did was let my son out of his stroller, as he'd been cooped up on an airplane and in a car for the entire day. I quickly discovered the room had not been adequately cleaned when he found and tried to eat a bunch of pieces of broken plastic that were on the carpet. [Will upload picture.] Obviously, this room had not been vacuumed. Despite this disappointing start, I ended up being pleased with the hotel. We ordered in for a late dinner, and I appreciated that the front desk called to confirm that we had ordered food before sending the deliveryman up. The room had a small refrigerator, microwave, and sink, which I always find handy. The tv was a large wall-mounted flatscreen that could be pulled out and angled toward either the bed or the couch. The bed was comfortable, and despite the proximity to the airport, I did not hear any noise from airplanes. The included breakfast was good: breads, muffins, cereals, a couple of hot items...your usual hotel breakfast fare. It was nice that there was a highchair available, though the safety strap was broken. The breakfast area was very busy, and there was competition for chairs. As soon as my husband and I stood up, two different other groups of people lunged for our chairs! So you may find the breakfast area to be a bit crowded, but that's just due to the sheer number of people who are all getting ready to leave around the same time (for cruises). I'm sure the seating area would be adequate under normal circumstances. The hotel is convenient to the airport, but there's not much else in the immediate area, so don't plan on being able to walk anywhere. I did not use the pool or exercise areas, so cannot comment on those. Overall, this hotel has some good rates available online that make a stay here a good value. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it.”
Reviews.Author: 591719Happy
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 7 adults and four children (all under 10) and booked 3 rooms. Stayed only one night before going on a cruise, great service from the front desk staff. We checked in around 6 PM front desk recommended and supplied take out menus for a quick bite, food arrived in about half an hour and it was fine. Buffet breakfast fine and a good selection from muffins to bacon and eggs. Transporation arranged by the front desk to the Miami port was even early. Overall "great price" and can't beat it for the night before a cruise. Only fault I saw was some rugs in the rooms were dirty from spilt food.

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed one short night”
Reviews.Author: theblues5
Reviews.Content: A family of 5, we need a spacious room, and this was pretty good. Very clean. Our rate was 159 and that was definetly a value.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant quiet location on a lagoon five minutes from airport”
Reviews.Author: foxurs1
Reviews.Content: What a find! we have stayed at the Mariott Hotel & Mariott Courtyard hotels near Miami airport before; the SpringHill Suites are part of the Mariott chain - with HUGE rooms & kitchenette, a view over a calm lagoon and you don't hear any airplanes. The breakfast is adequate; typically american with huge hoards of people 'dining' each morning. Most of whom are guests who are going on or coming from a cruise. The hotel has a small fitness room and outside pool (not heated!). The reception staff are simply lovely. Nothing is too much for them. As everywhere in Miami, it's best if you speak Spanish. Free parking and a shuttle takes you pretty much anywhere you want to be including car rental & airport.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for layover”
Reviews.Author: staceyvols
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a flight got cancelled. They gave us a distress rate and that is the only reason it was ok. We booked it for $159 which it would not have been worth. Paid about half of that. Stains on couch and carpet. Stains on toilet handle. Bed was comfortable. Huge TV that could be seen from couch or bed. Not near anything to eat. Ordered pizza from place that was recommended from front desk, it wasn't good. They do have airport shuttle, takes about 20 minutes to get to airport. Free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quite a find”
Reviews.Author: havlyn
Reviews.Content: Moved to this hotel after, leaving that horrible Fairfield Inn doral/west airport. This hotel is fantastic large rooms, great breakfast, nice pool and gym has free weights. Service is very good also great location. The rooms are nice it make you want to spend a couple extra hrs in it. My only complain is bathroom was small but other than that a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of outside influences, ask for parking insurance package”
Reviews.Author: DoeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Hotel had good accommodations except for the spider hiding in the phone. Service and breakfast was adequate . Went on a 7 day cruise with the intent of returning from a lovely vacation free of stress . Parked the Van in FRONT of the hotel ,full view of the security camera and security staff . Upon return from the cruise, the static LCD TV was stolen out of the van . Police called and came after 15 min, report made to police and the hotel. The hotel staff stated one did not fill out a parking package which was never offered to our traveling party .No one saw any thing, the alarm on the van was not heard supposedly. (even though they have full security ) . Visible tampering was seen on the back door of the Van in regards to a lock being tampered with. Hotel management stated they are not responsible for any loss and one was not allowed to look at the surveillance cameras. Hotel management, Ms Aviles at time , was not sympathetic and did not offer any type of compensatory coupons or discount for damages rendered on the property. All those who plan on staying for an extended time period , beware of parking in this area .Take all measures necessary to protect your vehicle and avoid the 850 dollars we needed to fix damages. We will next time park at the port of Miami and hopefully it will be much safer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, very friendly and caring staff”
Reviews.Author: bthomas2736
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my pre-cruise group. Jennifer was wonderful to check us all in and offer restaurant ideas. Omar was the shuttle driver and he was fantastic. He took us where we wanted to go and especially to La Rosa Cuban Restaurant. It was a fantastic treat, they served our group and paid a lot of attention to our requests. The chicken ws to die for! Anyway, my sister's husband who was in a wheelchair but was denied boarding for our ship for improper documentation and he insisted that we go on the cruise without him. I called ahead and explained to Jennifer the situation and she gave him the same room and assured me no problem they would take care of him while we cruised. We hated to leave and cruise without him but was sure that he would be okay. Omar spent a lot of time seeing that my brother-in-law went out to eat or to the store by taking him wherever he needed to go. I thought that was beyond the call of duty and so wonderful of the him. Some of the group went back to stay at the hotel when their flights were cancelled due a snow storm in chicago. I highly recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jlee2
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel , Clean Rooms& Updated spacious, The accomodations are good, Very close to Airport, With shuttle service, Free internet access, Excellent Continental Breakfast, Not too far from shopping and restaurants. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: mets550
Reviews.Content: Springhill Suites is on the lower end of the Marriott chain; however, the low end of Marriott is certainly better than most other types of hotels. Springhill Suites was clean, the lobby was nice and colorful, and the room was very nice and spacious. Overall, a very pleasant stay in anticipation of a phenomenal cruise vacation. The complimentary hotel shuttle picked us up from the MIA airport mid-afternoon. The driver was extremely courteous and professional. It was only a few minutes ride to the hotel. The hotel seems to have a deal with a shuttle company (Sunshine Shuttle or something like that--the main guy's name is Hector I believe) to take people to the Port of Miami for $10/person. This shuttle does not belong to the hotel. They told me that the earliest they could get us was noon, and we wanted to leave around 10 a.m. to be amongst the first to board. I had spoken with Hector several months earlier and we had agreed on a price of $30 total to take the two of us at 10 a.m. I told this to the woman at check-in, she called Hector, and after a lengthy conversation in Spanish, she informed me that the price was $35 and I'd have to contact him myself. The $5 was not important so much as the principle of a deal is a deal, so I called Hector from my room and he finally agreed to take us for $30. Not a big deal. The room was very nice. It was spacious and the bed was quite comfy. There was a nice couch when you walked in on the right and a kitchen/desk area on the left. Walking further into the room, the bed was on the right and a bathroom and outside vanity area on the left. There was plenty of space for my girlfriend and myself, and it was quite comfortable. We went down to the pool, but were a bit disappointed because (a) there was no hot tub (although I already knew this), (b) the building completely blocked the sun which was on the other side of the hotel, and (c) the water was a little dirty. However, none of this stopped my from jumping right in. Even though we weren't getting much of a tan, it was still nice to relax in the pool and on deck. I did not sleep much due to the overwhelming sense of excitement for our cruise, but that was no fault of the comfy bed. I went for a run in the morning--very nice. The major drawback of staying here is that it is not close to any other attractions, restaurants, etc. If you have a car this is not a big deal. If you are just staying for one night, it is not either. However, I would probably not stay here for more than a night or two--at least when on vacation--because there is not much to do at the hotel itself. However, we did have a fantastic stay, and I would highly recommend Springhill Suites, as it is a great bargain and a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDuncan81
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is just beautiful, can't beat it for the price! The rooms were spacious, with refreshing colors. I loved the tables that you use to put your computer on while sitting on the couch, it makes it so easy to use your laptop. The staff was always warm and attentive, great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service!”
Reviews.Author: karina5533
Reviews.Content: Staff was very courteous and willing to accomodate. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL & FRONT DESK WAS AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: mariaR79
Reviews.Content: I Arrived at the airport in the evening and called for the hotel for shuttle pick-up from the airport. Within 2 rings i was greeted by Jessica (who was very friendly and by her voice i could tell she was smiling as she was speaking to me which was very delightful) she told me EXACTLY where to wait for my pick-up and had the driver Omar over to get me within 15 minutes!! On the way to the hotel omar the driver informed me that he could take me and my husband to eat at an Italian restaurant free of charge which was excellent called (Anacapri by Bellacapri). Omar was able to drop us off and pick us up when we called to be taken back to the hotel which was wonderful. When we arrived at the desk upon check in and the young lady Jessica was very professional. She greeted us with a smile was so friendly answering all our questions about miami and the hotel like a pro!! Jessica is a great addition to the staff there at the Springhill Suites and i believe she should be rewarded for her generosity with the guests and not to mention she has amazing hospitality skills as well. I would hope management takes the time to read this and realize what great staff they have working for them. Omar and Jessica are what make this hotel run smoothly and what will have me and everyone back at home coming to this hotel for years to come! I look foward to coming back in the future. - Maria & Brandon

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: nyrobee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property with my bestfriend over my birthday weekend May 7-9 and had a blast. I checked in at about 8pm and there was no wait, the front desk agent Jessica was so helpful and accomodating. Upon arrival I needed a toothbrush and toothpaste which was provided without a problem. She also overheard me say it was my bithday and she wished me happy birthday and I went off to my room. Within Fifteen minutes after we arrived to the room the phone rang and it was Jessica calling to see how everything in the room was, which I replied was GREAT! I heard a knock at the door a few minutes later and to my suprise it was Jessica from the front desk with a birthday cake for me. I was so happy as this was the nicest thing a total stranger had done for me EVER! From that point on things were looking up, and over my stay I had no problems or complaints. I left miami feeling pleased with the decision I made for hotel accomodations and will never forget the level of service Jessica provided. Certainly the best stay and service ever! I also wanted to add that the free parking and free internet was a great touch, they also have a complimentary breakfast and an airport shuttle. With all the free extras it helps when your spending $50-$75 on a South Beach lunch or dinner!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for here”
Reviews.Author: Treebrook
Reviews.Content: Generally, my experience was what I had expected for the price during the high season in Miami. We used this hotel to stay ahead of our cruise which was the next day - they had a rate that included transportation to the cruise terminal and included breakfast which was attractive to us. The shuttle driver â€œOmarâ€� was great and picked us up at the airport promptly. In addition, he was able to shuttle us both ways to a local restaurant for the evening (the hotel has no capacity of lunch and dinner dining). There really is nothing in walking distance of this hotel â€“ everything is a short shuttle ride. The staffs at the front desk were very accommodating and courteous. The rooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable â€“ rooms were available upon arrival. For all of the above reasons, I will give this a favorable review. Areas of concern or needs improvement: There was a local â€œmusic festivalâ€� going on during our stay. It appeared that the rooms were packed with maximum occupancy (if not more) and they all showed up for breakfast at the same time in the morning (around the 9:00 AM hour). The lines for the breakfast were longer than I would have liked and it put pressure on the staff to put out a sub-standard self-serve breakfast. In fact, the eggs were COLD. No worry though as there was plenty of other items to eat. In addition, the pool area had some garbage that could have been thrown out (although the water and pool were fine) and when I went into the workout facility someone had left their plate of chicken bones on one of the chairs. I really donâ€™t blame the hotel for this, as I think there were a bunch of slobs attending this music festival who just were to lazy to clean up after themselves. Itâ€™s not the Ritz, and they donâ€™t have the staff there to do hourly clean up of these areas, so my headline comment is you get what you pay for here. Overall, I think I would give this hotel another shot, and the most important items of clean rooms and friendly staff were fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: nctravelnut99
Reviews.Content: We had a brief stay that required quick transport between MIA airport and our hotel for two nights (one on the way in, and one on the way home). This hotel was perfect for our needs. The staff was very sensitive to our requests (crib, bedding, a room away from noise). On our second stay, we actually requested to change rooms because the initial one we arrived in had been cleaned so recently that the smell was a little strong... "no problem". We want to especially give a "shout out" to George, the shuttle driver, who took us to CVS pharmacy to fill a Rx for our daughter. Staff was all lovely to us. This is a perfect place to stay if you need close access to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: gwill0701
Reviews.Content: Although none of us got our healthy amount of sleep because we were in Miami, beds were still comfy, the breakfast was great, and their front desk was always helpful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: abrugueras
Reviews.Content: My check-in was quick. The staff were helpful and very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: armandopr
Reviews.Content: Don't believe what people say. I have stayed at the Springhill Suites a couple of times on business and with friends. Very nice hotel, excellent staff and location is perfect. Restaurants near by which shuttle service takes you and picks you up. If your loking to stay for a pre-cruise stay here which they have transportation to port inquire at the front-desk. Overall wonderful hotel. If you like you can email and I will answer other questions.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - Don't Do it!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny12255
Reviews.Content: With so many hotel options in Miami, I am terribly disappointed that we spent four nights at this hotel. While the appearance of the lobby and the rooms is nice, the service is incredibly terrible. From rooms not being cleaned (two rooms on two separate days) to shopping bags of new clothes tossed in the trash by the cleaning staff, my stay at Spring Hill Suites was one of the worst that I've spent in my travels.....and I've traveled on four continents. The rooms, though newly remodeled and nicely appointed, have terrible ventilation. My party booked three rooms, and all complained of "stuffy" rooms and HVAC systems that simply did not work properly. But perhaps the worst part of my stay was the response of the staff when approached about missing items or unclean rooms. They showed not interest in resolving issues. Very disappointing! And while the free coffee and tea in the lobby was a nice perk, the lackluster breakfast was disappointing. Overall, I would recommend finding another hotel when visiting Miami. Spring Hill Suites was a terrible disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: therealmike
Reviews.Content: The big problem here is that they reportedly let people leave their cars in the parking lot while they fly - meaning that the lot fills up and the PAYING customers have to leave their cars in the driveway every night. NOT ACCEPTABLE. Currently under a very messy lobby renovation. Slow elevators. Very slow internet. Weird rooms with noisy wall unit AC units 12 inches from the bed. Cannot hang a shirt up because the dresser is IN THE CLOSET. Poor maid service. Nasty breakfast with flies and bugs swarming over everything. Uncomfortable beds with thin blankets. Weird policy where they only let some pizza places come in (kickbacks?) Strange clientele with people hanging out all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL...HORRIBLE BREAKFAST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Huaso111
Reviews.Content: Everything you could expect from this hotelÂ´s category. Absolutely good value for money. The only thing is that breakfast service really sucks. Really crowded, not enough tables, unefficient system. I came down at 10h00 and had to come back to my room with all I could carry in a disposable plate. Not good at all. They should do something about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ASTEC
Reviews.Content: WOW, they changed they rooms. They are newly, with a flat TV.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for a good price too!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCanuk
Reviews.Content: Springhill has recently been renovated, Rooms very nice with flat screen TV,s very modern looking .Very comfortable bed with new linens, Normal contintental breakfast free, and nice size outdoor pool. For the price the best choice, close to airport, 15-20 minutes to the port of miami. Can leave car there for the week free if desired, if going on a cruise. Best Value for a overnight stay, Longer stay you probably would want a nicer location as it is in a business park area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, new!! Great service and fair price”
Reviews.Author: Andeya
Reviews.Content: Beds are very comfy and the Front Desk person (gentleman) at night is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The new rooms are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: OlgaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: The hotel have beautiful rooms. The rooms have been renovated and they look great. The service was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.... not horrible, but close.”
Reviews.Author: fishingfool329
Reviews.Content: Had to wait 45 mins and make 4 calls to have the shuttle bus pick us up at the airport. shuttle only returns to the airport once per hour. Got to the room and first thing the kids saw was a large roach head behind the refrigerator. Told the manager-on-suty about it and got no response whatsoever. Walls and doors are paper thin, lots of loud neighbors at night and then again in the early morning. As someone else said, not that close to the airport and nothing nearby. Room, carpet, furniture was all very cheap, but in decent condition. Expected more for a room at almost $200 per night (although we used 15,000 Marriott points). Won't go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “only stay here if absolutely necessary!”
Reviews.Author: DianeER
Reviews.Content: We felt this hotel did not live up to Marriott standards at all & was one of the worse Marriott's we have ever been too. We would only recommend if you have no where else to go. Our room was not clean - the bathroom was dirty with hair all over the floor. I walked barefoot on the rug & my feet were black. They gave us a room outside the elevator & each time the call button rang we could hear it loudly in the room. The hotel had no carpeting outside the elevators in a large area on each floor & we could hear every suitcase that rattled on the floor. The hotel was undergoing renovations so there was lots of debris in the stairways. Ice machines are not located on every floor. The front desk staff was very rude & some of the worse we have ever encountered. When I checked in the phone rang & the clerk picked it up & continued a conversation instead of putting the person on hold. I felt that was very unprofessional as he continued the conversation the entire time he helped me. The breakfast was a disaster as there was not enough seats, no one to bus the tables, they were out of all food & took a long time to restock it. The fitness room smelled moldy & I would not go into it as I felt it was unusable. The small pool was in, I think, a parking lot & was not conducive to a nice relaxed area one thinks of. The foam green color in the room was hideous. The flat screen TV was large but didn't swivel well. The sofa was hard & wasn't comfortable. In fairness, the general manager was working the front desk one morning & so I told her the problems & she took off a night stays. We had redeemed Marriott points to stay here. The nearest restaurant is a long walk away although the hotel does have a free shuttle service depending on availability. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere with nothing nearby. We did not hear any noise from the nearby airport. The General Manager told the desk attendant we had complained & he apologized to us. We appreciated his apology but felt he should not have confronted us to say anything at all as it was awkward for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, not much in surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: finally1122
Reviews.Content: When we first entered the hotel we were greeted to a lobby full of boxes, a consequence of an ongoing renovation that the website failed to mention. When we expressed our disappointment to the check in clerk, we were met with a "take it-or-leave it" mentality. After calling a few other Marriott properties in the area and dreading getting back into another taxi to go driving, we decided to stay there anyways. The room was surprisingly large, with a separate sitting area and pull out sofa bed. There was an area with mini fridge, microwave and sink. The room was very pleasant and included comfortable beds and a large plasma TV. We were very satisfied with the space we would be living in for the night. Since there was nothing in the immediate area to do for the night, we ordered pizza and a movie and veged out on our last night in Miami. Our room looked out on the airport runway in the distance which was cool. The pool area was very disappointing, a small gated in area overlooking the parking lot. For Miami, I would have expected something a bit more tropical and relaxing. Palm trees and a Jacuzzi would have hit the spot. The free lobby breakfast was plentiful and diverse (egg patties, waffles, oatmeal, yogurt, ect). The hotel is very convenient to the airport and has a Free prompt airport shuttle system. We also found the free business center and small market helpful during our stay. Overall we had a chill, low key one night stay. The room was great, but the surrounding area was dead (no restaurants, nightlife). A true pool scene would have been nice; we would probably choose another hotel in the area that provides such an amenity in the future.

Reviews.Title: “IT was OK”
Reviews.Author: eastatl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 2 nights at this hotel. It is a nice location and the hotel looks nice too. The room was a great size, clean and with a very comfortable bed. They have a free internet, nice size pool and the breakfast was all right also. However, the staff was a disappoinment. I work at a hotel myself and know that the front desk clerk is the main key. I believe they should have a nicer and brighter personality and greet their guests with a smile. Too bad that in two days, they did not even say hi to me when i came back to the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites Miami Airport South
